author: Ching-He Huang
method: Heat a wok until smoking and add the groundnut oil, then add the garlic and chilli and stir fry for a few seconds. Add the prawns, rice wine and lime juice and stir fry for 2-3 minutes, or until the prawns start to turn pink.  Add the French beans and stir fry for another 2-3 minutes, or until the prawns are cooked through. Season, to taste, with the salt and chilli flakes. Pile the chilli prawns onto a serving plate and serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 tbsp groundnut oil or vegetable oil,  5 garlic cloves, finely chopped,  1 red chilli, finely chopped,  200g/7oz raw tiger prawns, shelled and de-veined ,  1 tbsp Shaoxing rice wine or dry sherry,  1 lime, juice only,  75g/3oz French beans, topped and tailed, chopped into 1cm/Â½in pieces,  pinch sea salt,  1 tsp dried chilli flakes
